div.h3: Resources for Special Educators, Therapists, & Families

h2.span: Resources for Special Educators, Therapists, & Families

div.h2: Curated resources for those working with individuals who have developmental disabilities.
div.div: Thanks to all the creators from around the globe whose work is listed here. Your generosity in making these resources freely available is greatly appreciated.

iframe.data-title: The best way to wash your hands to help prevent diseases, like coronavirus | Just The FAQs

div.div: The best way to wash your hands to help prevent diseases, like coronavirus | Just The FAQs

a.data-description: You can download the PPT file here. You may want to edit page 5 to suggest coughing/sneezing into the crook of their elbow (not covering with their hands). Thanks to Stefani Dutcher for sharing this work.
If you use the Snap Core First software from Tobii Dynavox, you can download this page on Covid-19 here.
Brilliant Dust created this resource. Check out these helpful posters here,

a.data-description: Families can create an account, free of charge for 30 days and easily create games, visual support to explain the Covid-19, visual schedule for home routines and anything they need to make these coming weeks easier on the children. Click here then select the monthly standard access.Use the promo code HOMEVISUALS on checkout.
You can view this resource by Sheryl Nussbaum-Beach and download the guide here.
Check out these resources from News 2 You.

a.data-description: This poster from Tactus Therapy may be helpful to people with aphasia or other language processing difficulties. You can download it here.

Tina developed a wonderful collection of Covid-19 and related resources created with Boardmaker. You can see those here.

a.data-description: Check out the Autism Society's Covid-19 Toolkit.
Tobii Dynavox shares a variety of resources, including downloadable communication boards in multiple languages.

When people are intubated, which sometimes to those who get seriously ill with Covid-19, they may be unable to speak. The Patient Provider Communication Network has many important resources to download, including communication boards.

a.data-description: The wonderful team at ARASAAC created a number of excellent resources in Spanish for their Open Classroom project.

Check out ARASAAC's additional materials on Covid-19 here (Spanish).
